meanings.definition: raggediest: superlative form of ragged, meaning torn or tattered
meanings.sent1: The raggediest old blanket was full of holes.
meanings.sent2: She wore the raggediest jeans to the party.
meanings.sent3: The raggediest scarecrow in the field looked like it needed a vacation.
meanings.sent4: His voice sounded like the raggediest piece of fabric, worn out from years of use.
meanings.sent5: The raggediest flag fluttered in the wind, barely holding on to its last threads.

meanings.definition: raggediest: most worn-out or shabby in appearance
meanings.sent1: The raggediest book on the shelf had missing pages.
meanings.sent2: After years of use, the raggediest sofa needed to be replaced.
meanings.sent3: The raggediest umbrella decided to retire after one too many rainy days.
meanings.sent4: Her shoes looked like the raggediest pair in the entire store.
meanings.sent5: The raggediest house on the block had a charm that no new building could match.
